channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023060899
item.description:
Report X-2023060899

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the dock with wet outer packaging. Package is thought to have been tilt over while in transit, causing the removable lid on the drum to leak. DescribePack: Inner contents drum leaked out of the removable lid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was placed within a plastic hazardous waste bag, and then placed into a salvage drum.

DescribePack: some liquid from inner jerrican spilled out of the lid, causing outter packaging damage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed within a hazardous waste bag, and then into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report I-2023060095
item.description:
Report I-2023060095

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: Greensboro
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured 2 pails in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the pails putting a 1.0 inch long puncture in the pails. Pails were then removed and placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2023060655
item.description:
Report X-2023060655

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-27
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A manager in the bulk area brought us this bucket/pail because it looked like there was a little leak on top of the pail at the cap. We inspected and it did have a loose cap and a small leak on top and down the side of the pail. We made sure to get this isolated in the hazmat cage in a lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure that this pail didn't leak on any other packages and then we moved it to the hazmat cage immediately.

item.title: Report E-2023060137
item.description:
Report E-2023060137

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: WINTERVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 9, 2023, one (1) 325-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide leaked approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior due to a faulty valve. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. MEG personnel transferred all virgin product into one (1) new 275-gallon tote via diaphragm pump. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all sodium hydroxide impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The damaged tote and drum of waste were transported for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060290
item.description:
Report X-2023060290

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE MANAGER IN THE IC PICK AREA ALERTED US TO A LEAKING BUCKET/PAIL. WE REPSONDED IMMEDIATLEY AND FOUND THAT THE BUCKET HAD LEAKED ON A NON HAZMAT PACKAGE AND IT SATURATED THE BOX INSIDE AND OUT. WE MADE SURE TO CLEAN UP THE AREA AND PUT ALL OF OUR MATERIALS IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE WITH THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE AND THE NON HAZMAT PACKAGE. WE THEM ISOLATED THESE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL HAD A 1/8" CRACK ON IT AND THAT IS WHAT LEAD TO THE RELEASE OF THE FLUID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE RESPONDED IMMEDIATELY AND MADE SURE THAT THE PAKCAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED TO THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023060280
item.description:
Report X-2023060280

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA DURING THE SORT DUE TO THE SIDE OF THE BOX BEING WET. PKG WAS THEN SECURED UNTIL IT COULD BE FURHTER INSPECTED. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE JUGS. PACKAGE MAY HAVE BEEN LOADED OR HANDLED IMPROPERLY CAUSING IT TO LEAK EVEN FURTHER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS UPRIGHT AND SECURED IN A HAZMAT DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023060194
item.description:
Report X-2023060194

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found on dock laying sideways, with the orientation arrows not upright. Package was wet from inner contents. Inner contents consist of 2 plastic bottles about a half gallon in size. Both spilt from the caps. DescribePack: due to laying sideways, inner liquid excaped the caps on the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was immediately placed within a yellow salvage drum.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed inside of a damage bin for QA to inspect during sort. When the package was found by QA it had signs on an internal leak and a strong chemical odor coming from inside the package. After inspection of the package and its content the plastic jug of the liquid was found leaking from the bottom side of the container. DescribePack: Inner container was punctured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic bin.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was in unload and it was mishandled and the body of the bottle is cracked at the time found it was put in black container and brought to QA. DescribePack: The package failure is a crack in the body near the handle where it is put togather and the crack is about 3/16 long DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was put in container and put some absorbing around it also and put in the QA haz-mat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023050808
item.description:
Report X-2023050808

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-13
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to us from the IC belt manager. He found this in the back of the building on one of his dock walks during the sort and let us know that there was powder coming out of the package. Upon inspection we saw that this was solid chlorine granules. The package has been attempted 3 times by our delivery driver and the customer was never home to sign for this package. These packages aren't meant to be handled this amount of times. We isolated this in a lined hazmat tote in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The lid was loose upon inspection and that is where the powder was coming from. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure that the area where the package was found was clean and no powder contaminated any other boxes

  • City: GREENVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Advised by staff member that hazmat was placed in the opposite direction of arrows, this may have contributed to leakage. Hazmat was separated from other packages and placed in a plastic bin to contain spillage. DescribePack: Loose cap due to improper handling, all caps were retightened to prevent further leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed inside of a plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2023050524
item.description:
Report X-2023050524

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The initial cause of damage is unknown, but the package was already leaking when discovered by management in the early afternoon. Package was properly handled and removed from the discovery site and placed in holding in a Hazmat safe work area for further investigation and processing. DescribePack: Closure on bottle was loose or unevenly threaded when closed, causing minor leakage of product. Bottle tag and upper closure of outer pak were discolored and burned from leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was safely transported and placed in a Hazmat safe area and away from the common area where package had been located.

item.title: Report X-2023050493
item.description:
Report X-2023050493

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that the cap on one of the plastic jugs of isopropyl alcohol was loose causing the contents to leak. The only packaging was a corrugated liner. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023050489
item.description:
Report X-2023050489

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This pail/bucket was brought to us on 5/5/23 from the back of the building by a dock manager. A package handler noticed the lid was bent and the cap had liquid oozing around the rim. We made sure to isolate this in a lined hazmat tote and placed it in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The lid is a little bent and it looks like it caused the cap to come loose. The size is about 1/8" where the liquid is releasing from the bucket. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed this in a lined hazmat tote as soon as it was brought to us and also inspected where the bucket was found to make sure that no other packages became contaminated.
